text.p: Maltese shares ened higher , with the share index rising 15.88 points on Wednesday. Gains were made by all listed companies except soft drinks maker Farsons.
Market turnover topped 2.1 million Malta pounds, ($5.46m) up from 1.7 million pounds the week before.

Mid-Med Bank made the biggest gains for the second successive week, the average price of its shares rising by 3.4 cents. Just under 9,800 shares were traded in 20 deals for an average price of 169.6 cents per share.
Prices in Bank of Valletta gained 2.2 cents, with 88,797 shares selling in 59 deals for an average 135.5 cents.
Average prices in Lombard Bank rose by 2.7cents, with 4,520 shares selling for an average 158.4 cents in three deals.
Average prices in Middle Sea Insurance gained 1.8 cents, with 8,650 shares selling in 14 deal for 122.8 cents.
There were two deals in Simonds Farsons Cisk, with 1,050 shares selling for an average of 48.6 cents, down seven mils, the same loss as the previous trading session.
Suncrest Hotels shares gained 1.2 cents, with 10,000 shares selling in two deals for an average 72 cents.
Trading in government bonds saw a turnover of 1.9 million pounds, with75 deals in 18 securities.

There were three deals in 6.5 percent Gasan bonds 1998/99 at 98.9 cents each, unchanged. There were 24 deals in 7.25 percent Mid-Med Bank unsubordinated loan stock 2005 at 98.5 cents, no change, and two deals in 8.25 percent Suncrest Bonds 2005/7 at 100.5, up 0.2 mils.
The share index closed at 1054.82. $1: 0.38c2 Malta pounds
